getTimer

javax.swing.Timer getTimer()
Returns the javax.swing.Timer object in it current state. This object will be used to run or stop the program's execution

javax.swing.Timer Object

getSnake

Snake getSnake()
Retourne l'objet Snake dans son etat courant. Cet objet represente le serpent et toutes ses caracteristiques Returns the Snake object in it current state. This object stands for the snake and all it characteristics

Returns:
Snake Object

updatePosition

void updatePosition(Snake snake)
                    throws BorderException
This methods is used to update the Snake's position each time the timer wake up the current process. It only updates the snake's position, and not it directions. This is updated by a method from the Snake class called updateDirections()

Parameters:
snake - that this method updates it position
Throws:
BorderException - If the snake's new position is in contact with a wall
See Also:
SnakeInterface

move

void move()
          throws BitItSelfException
This method checks is the snake isn't eating a food or a special food at the moment it's called. This method is the one called by the main process, and calls the method updatePosition(Snake). It also repaints the graphic panel each time it's called.

Throws:
BitItSelfException - If the snake is eating it own tail.
